io.spine.client

Class ClientRequest

  • java.lang.Object
    • io.spine.client.ClientRequest
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    CommandRequest, FilteringRequest

    public class ClientRequest
extends java.lang.Object
    Entry point for creating client requests.

    An instance of this class is obtained via Client.onBehalfOf(UserId) or Client.asGuest() methods and then used for creating a specific client request e.g. for posting a command.

    A client request may be customized using fluent API provided by the deriving classes.

    Some features such as running an EntityQuery are available directly from this class.

    See Also:
    Client

      Assigns a handler for errors occurred when delivering messages from the server.

      • run

        public <S extends io.spine.base.EntityState<?>> com.google.common.collect.ImmutableList<S> run(io.spine.query.EntityQuery<?,S,?> query)
        Runs the EntityQuery and returns the matched entity states.

        Usage example: 

        
 Customer.Query query = Customer.query()
              .id().in(westCoastCustomerIds())
              .type().is(CustomerType.PERMANENT)
              .discountPercent().is(10)
              .companySize().is(Company.Size.SMALL)
              .withMask(nameAddressAndEmail)
              .sortAscendingBy(name())
              .limit(20)
              .build();
 ImmutableList<Customer> customers = client.onBehalfOf(currentUser).run(query);
        Type Parameters:
        S - the type of the entity state for which the query is run

      • onStreamingError

        @CanIgnoreReturnValue
 @OverridingMethodsMustInvokeSuper
public ClientRequest onStreamingError(ErrorHandler handler)
        Assigns a handler for errors occurred when delivering messages from the server.

        If such an error occurs, no more results are expected from the server.

      • onServerError

        @CanIgnoreReturnValue
 @OverridingMethodsMustInvokeSuper
public ClientRequest onServerError(ServerErrorHandler handler)
        Assigns a handler for an error occurred on the server-side (such as validation error) in response to posting a request.
